author: Staff Reporter
text:
Inspector General of Police M. N. Manjunatha, who assumed charge as Police Commissioner here on Wednesday, said that a requisition seeking more police personnel had been sent to the State Police Chief's office.“Presently, the city police have 600-odd people against the sanctioned strength of 900-odd posts”, he told reporters.

Stating that steps to trace people gone missing and crime prevention and detection will be given focus, Mr. Manjunatha said that a study would be carried out to overcome the traffic snarls.

“We will refine the available policing system to deal with issues pertaining to crime against women and any trafficking of children,” he added.

Belonging to 1991 batch of Indian Police Service, Mr. Manjunatha got earlier selected for Indian Audit and Accounts Service (IA&AS) through the previous year's civil service examination. However, he did not join the service.

A native of Bengaluru, he graduated in civil engineering. After the IPS training at National Police Academy at Shivaramapalli near Hyderabad, he started his service as Assistant Superintendent of Police at Karaikudi.
title: More police personnel sought for Tirupur city
